text: Hi everyone, How do I delete Custom Schema

Last time I did it I used the API
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>

I’m not sure if HubSpot has added a better way since then
<@U04H4762R89> I’m wondering about the exact same thing. Did you figured it out?

Hi everyone! I am trying to integrate the HubSpot chat widget using the `inlineEmbedSelector` option. I have a couple of questions.
1. On using the `inlineEmbedSelector` option, the widget closes only on using `widget.remove` . So, I will have to implement `widget.load` and `widget.remove` instead of `widget.open`  and `widget.close` to display and hide the widget. Calling `widget.load` makes network calls for multiple files. Is there a better way to achieve this?
2. Also, on using the `inlineEmbedSelector` option, the mobile specific widget styles are not applied. Is there a way to load the mobile specific widget which loads by default along with `inlineEmbedSelector` option?
Any help would be appreciated. Thanks!
You can do it now through the UI now (90% sure), you just need to delete all the object for the Schema first
are there any plans to add security to the products table so we can hide custom columns like purchase price ?
Not sure if this is the right channel but figured i'd give it a go
This message was deleted.
You'll have better luck if you post this in <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>
Duh, I will move this. Thanks!
You're totally good man, just wanted to make sure you knew

oh that is a perfect solution <@U01QVR44MEY>

If you build a custom module, then you have to expose the api key in your module, so you have to build stuff in a cloud server to manage that. It has oauth stuff, it was always messy for me. I haven’t created one in a few years, but I’ve been asked about it again from multiple people
Yeah, I use this approach for everything related to twitter, instagram, and facebook
And the RSS feed gets rid of all the necessary OAuth stuff and all that <@U25PYL3Q8>?
Yep
you just get a public url
wow, cool, thanks so much for that tip! that is awesome

I'm looking the way to create a custom workflow action.

Thanks in advance.
I suggest reading up on them here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions> and if you have any questions post them in the <#C019VT42R8X|workflows> channel
